Indonesia GDP Grows 5.11% in 2025, Missing Government Target
body: Indonesia’s economy grows 5.11% in 2025, beating the previous year’s performance but falling short of the government’s 5.2% target.

title: Antam Gold Still Up 18% in 2026
body: Antam gold pulls back after a surge but stays near record levels as central banks sustain strong buying interest.

title: Australia in Talks for Indonesia’s $5 Billion Waste-to-Energy Projects
body: Indonesia is gearing up to set up waste-to-energy plants: a multibillion-dollar project that is open for foreign participarticipation.

title: JCI Gains Early but Caution Lingers on Foreign Sell-Off, Free Float Reforms
body: JCI opened higher as investors awaited GDP data, weighed foreign outflows, and tracked IPO plans, free float reforms.

title: Finance Minister Backs KPK Arrests of Tax, Customs Officials
body: Minister Purbaya backed KPK arrests of tax and customs officials, pledging internal reforms while offering legal support to staff.

title: Danantara to Break Ground on 3 Million-Ton Steel Plant to Cut Indonesia’s Import Reliance
body: The steel plant is being developed through a partnership between state-owned steelmaker Krakatau Steel and China’s Delong Steel Group.

title: Rupiah Slips to Rp 16,772 on Cautious Sentiment Ahead of GDP, US Data
body: Rupiah weakened on Wednesday as investors stayed cautious ahead of key US data and Indonesia’s fourth-quarter GDP release.

title: Investors Hold Tight Despite Gold Hitting All-Time Peaks, Says WGC
body: Gold prices surged in 2025 but investors are not yet taking profits, indicating sustained interest in gold as a long-term investment.

title: JCI Edges Higher as Small Caps Rally Despite MSCI Pressure
body: JCI edged higher on Wednesday, lifted by sharp small-cap gains, even as investors stayed cautious over MSCI-related pressures.

title: Illegal Used Clothing Imports Squeeze Indonesia’s Textile Industry
body: Illegal secondhand clothing imports are undercutting Indonesia’s textile industry, costing tax revenue and triggering job losses.

title: IDX Targets 49 Companies Covering 90% of Market Cap in Free-Float Pilot
body: IDX has selected 49 large-cap issuers covering nearly 90% of market value as a pilot group for the phased rollout of a 15% free-float rule.

title: Barito Renewables to Buyback Shares Worth Up to $120 Million
body: BREN plans a share buyback of up to Rp2 trillion using internal cash to support share performance amid volatile markets.

title: Palm Oil Steadies With India Imports Up, Indonesia Policy on Watch
body: Palm oil prices steadied after recent volatility as weak demand signals from China were offset by a surge in Indian imports

title: Government Tightens Oversight as Tax Revenue Rises 30% in January
body: Indonesia’s January tax revenue surged 30% year-on-year, as the government rolled out Coretax and tightened compliance oversight.

title: Antam Gold Jumps Rp 102,000 as Global Bullion Prices Recover
body: Antam gold rebounded on Wednesday after a steep correction, tracking a global rally that lifted spot prices over 9% overnight.

title: JCI Dips Slightly as Investors Weigh Tax Windfall and Global Rate Worries
body: JCI edged down in early trade, with upbeat fiscal data offset by global tech selloffs and cautious sentiment.

title: Indonesia Hopes Upcoming UK Trade Pact Talks Won’t Take Long Like EU
body: It took around a decade for Indonesia to finalize the trade deal negotiations with the EU.

title: Indonesia’s January Tax Revenue Jumps 30%, Major Tax Office Shake-Up to Proceed
body: Indonesia’s January tax revenue rose about 30% year on year, but major staff rotations will continue as part of tax reforms.

title: Indonesia Pushes Coal-Based DME to Replace LPG for Cooking Fuel
body: Indonesia consumes around 8.5 million tons of LPG annually, while local production supplies only about 1.3 million tons.

title: Coal Gasification Projects Head to Groundbreaking Stage
body: The coal-to-DME project is among six downstream initiatives set to break ground as Indonesia accelerates its energy strategy.
